body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let y=4.999999999999............(infinity)\nthen find the value of floor y."}]}]}

title: Roots Always Become Smaller, Right?
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which of the following mathematical symbol should we place in the box below to make the following statement true?\n"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \\large \\sqrt{0.99} \\; \\Box \\; 0.99 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For positive values "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the range "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x > 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{x} < x"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Eg. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=4,\;\sqrt{4}=2,\;2<4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For positive values "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the range "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0 < x < 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{x} > {x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Eg. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=0.01,\;\sqrt{0.01} = 0.1,\; 0.1 > 0.01"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0.99"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" falls into the second category, therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{0.99}\; \boxed{>} \,0.99"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 0 All Around

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Label the grid:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"table","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"tableRow","content":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"tableRow","content":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"tableRow","content":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"g"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Fix two rows and consider the three equations in them:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+d+b+e = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+d+c+f = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b+e+c+f = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can add them together to obtain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2(a+d) + 2(b+e) + 2(c+f) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Divide by two and subtract each of the original three equations separately to obtain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+d = 0, b+e = 0, c+f = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can do the same for the other two pairs. We obtain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+g = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d+g = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" among the six equations produced. Now take this and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+d = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and do the same thing as above: sum, divide by two, subtract each. We have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 0, d = 0, g = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can get the same with the others, giving all zeroes."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus we solved the system, obtaining the solution of all zeroes; this must be the answer. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: We have 9 linear equations in 9 variables. Since there is only one solution (all zeroes), this shows that none of the linear equations are redundant!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            K, I've converted it into a comment at the end of the solution, so that it's not too confusing.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yes, that's why I said that. Although on retrospect, I didn't use it, since my solution directly leads to the unique solution of all zeroes without showing they are all linearly independent, so that's superfluous.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I don't understand the first paragraph. You have not shown that none of the equations are redundant."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It is a conclusion from your solution, that yes none of the solutions are redundant. However, I don't see an easy to tell that right from the start.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}
